intro: Sarcotheca sericea, commonly known as the silky sarcocarp, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warmer climates.
